name: Icy-Cold Korean Cucumber Soup (Oi Naengguk)
description: Using only a few key ingredients, this refreshing Korean cucumber soup delivers tons of savory flavor. With the addition of ice to keep it frosty, and a topping of roasted sesame seeds for a final nutty note, this soup will fool your taste buds into thinking a lot more went into making it than actually did.
recipeIngredient: One 1-pound (500g) cucumber, preferably Korean or English (about 8 to 10 inches/20 to 25cm long; see note)
2 tablespoons (30ml) Joseon ganjang (Korean soup soy sauce; see note)
2 tablespoons (30ml) Korean yangjo vinegar (brown rice vinegar; see note)
18 ounces ice cubes (500g; the equivalent of 2 1/4 cups/500ml water frozen into cubes)

recipeInstructions.text: Cut cucumber into roughly 4-inch (10cm) lengths. Using a knife or mandoline, julienne the cucumber as finely as you can.
In a large mixing bowl, combine cucumber with garlic, water, soy sauce, and vinegar, stirring to distribute ingredients. Season with salt. Transfer to refrigerator if not serving right away.
When ready to serve, add ice cubes and season once more with salt, if needed. Sprinkle sesame seeds on top. Ladle into individual bowls, along with the ice cubes, and serve.
